articles.title: 'The game has gone' - a bad night for VAR in semi-final
articles.summary: Manchester City's 2-0 win over Newcastle in the first leg of the Carabao Cup semi-final was overshadowed by a contentious decision to disallow a goal from Antoine Semenyo in the second half.

articles.title: Newcastle vs Man City live: Rayan Cherki adds late second goal after controversial VAR incident
articles.summary: Newcastle 0-2 Man City: Late Rayan Cherki goal leaves Magpies with a mountain to climb in Carabao Cup semi-finals
articles.author: Richard Jolly and Chris Wilson

articles.title: Pak embarrassed: After Rizwan’s retired-out episode, Ali also errs – Watch
articles.summary: Pakistan players endured further embarrassment in the Big Bash League as Hasan Ali’s misfield gifted a boundary during Adelaide Strikers’ loss to Melbourne Stars, just a day after Mohammad Rizwan became the first overseas player to be retired out. Tom Curran’s career-best spell then helped the Stars bowl Strikers out for 83 and seal an easy win.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: RCB To Move Out Of Chinnaswamy? Franchise Finalises Two New Venues For IPL 2026
articles.summary: RCB To Move Out Of Chinnaswamy? Franchise Finalises Two New Venues For IPL 2026

articles.title: 'Found out only after squad was announced': Jitesh Sharma on T20 WC snub
articles.summary: Wicketkeeper-batter Jitesh Sharma expressed devastation after learning of his T20 World Cup 2026 omission, admitting the news came as a shock without prior communication. Despite initial heartbreak, he accepted the selectors' reasoning after discussions. Jitesh found solace in family and guidance from Dinesh Karthik to move past the disappointment.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: Broad: Current England squad do not have drinking culture
articles.summary: Former England bowler Stuart Broad says he believes England "do not have a drinking culture," despite a number of high-profile incidents during the side's 4-1 Ashes defeat to Australia this winter.

articles.title: 'What rubbish is this?': Ex-WC winner explodes over Ayush Badoni call-up
articles.summary: Former chief selector Krishnamachari Srikkanth has fiercely criticised Ayush Badoni's ODI call-up, questioning the selection basis and hinting at favouritism. Srikkanth argued against Badoni's all-rounder status and highlighted inconsistent selection criteria. The team management, however, defended the move, citing Badoni as a like-for-like replacement for the injured Washington Sundar to ensure team balance.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: IND vs NZ: Why Ayush Badoni? Team India breaks silence
articles.summary: Ayush Badoni joins the Indian ODI squad for the New Zealand series. Batting coach Sitanshu Kotak highlighted Badoni's consistent performances for India A and in the IPL. He offers a valuable sixth bowling option. Badoni's inclusion provides flexibility to the team's bowling attack. He has a strong record in List A and IPL cricket.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: Du Plessis ruled out of rest of SA20 with thumb injury
articles.summary: This is the second major injury blow for JSK after Rossouw was ruled out with a hamstring complaint

articles.title: Kohli vs Tendulkar: The ‘nervous’ 90s and the great ‘What If’
articles.summary: Virat Kohli is in exceptional form, achieving six consecutive fifty-plus scores, including two centuries. This remarkable run brings his international century tally to 84, just 16 shy of Sachin Tendulkar's record. A recent 93 against New Zealand highlights his consistent performance, fueling speculation about his potential if 'nervous' nineties were converted.
articles.author: Hijam Raju Singh

articles.title: Why Virat has always stayed ahead of Rohit in ODIs — ex-India batter explains
articles.summary: Mohammad Kaif attributes Virat Kohli's ODI dominance over Rohit Sharma to his exceptional mindset and ability to convert starts into match-winning scores. Kaif highlighted Kohli's self-awareness and relentless standards, even after a significant knock. Kohli's recent fifty-plus streak in ODIs is also noted, bringing him closer to a new Indian record.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: ICC ODI Rankings: Back where he belongs — Virat Kohli returns to No.1
articles.summary: Virat Kohli has reclaimed the No.1 spot in the ICC ODI batting rankings after a stellar 93 against New Zealand. This marks his 11th stint at the top, underscoring his enduring dominance and a remarkable sequence of recent performances. The Indian great continues his pursuit of Sachin Tendulkar's records, solidifying his legacy as a premier run-scorer.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: Kohli set to surpass Sachin, Dravid, Rohit, Rahane; closes in on historic feat
articles.summary: Virat Kohli is on the cusp of a new Indian record, aiming for his sixth consecutive ODI fifty-plus score against New Zealand in Rajkot. This remarkable streak places him alongside legends like Tendulkar and Dravid.  With an exceptional recent run, Kohli's form is a major talking point as India seeks to extend their series lead.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: 'It's a format that we enjoy playing': Nicholls hopeful ahead of 2nd ODI
articles.summary: Ahead of the second ODI, New Zealand’s Henry Nicholls said bilateral series have become vital with limited ODI cricket before major events like the 2027 World Cup. He called the format exciting and praised his team’s adaptation against Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. India lead the series 1-0 after a four-wicket win in the opener.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: Why teams are rethinking death-overs batting after ICC ball tweak
